N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 587.5 - Enforcement and Adjudicatory Procedure

State Regulations
(a) University police officers are authorized
to issue traffic tickets and/or parking citations against a driver and/or
vehicle in violation of traffic and parking regulations or any violation of
this Part. Traffic tickets issued pursuant to this Part shall be adjudicated in
a court with jurisdiction over such violation, and parking citations shall be
adjudicated in accordance with procedures provided in this section. (b) A parking citation issued for any
violation of this Part shall follow the following procedure: (1)

The parking citation shall be subscribed
by the officer witnessing the violation; shall include the time and place when
the citation was issued; and shall be served upon the alleged violator or
attached to the vehicle involved. (2)

The parking citation shall indicate the
fine assessable for the violation and shall state that if the person charged
does not request a hearing on the violation prescribed herein, the fine shall
be paid by mail or in person at the System Administration, Business Office
located at SUNY Plaza, 353 Broadway, Albany NY 12246, or such place as may be
designated on the citation, within fourteen calendar days after the service of
the citation. (3)

The parking
citation shall recite that the person alleged to have committed the violation
may request a hearing within 72 hours after service of the charges by such
alleged violator appearing in person or responding in writing to the University
police department, or such other place as may be designated on the
citation. (4)

The parking citation
shall recite that if the alleged violator fails to appear at the time and place
fixed for the hearing, or should no hearing be requested as provided herein, an
appropriate penalty shall be imposed based upon the violation
alleged. (c) The

Chancellor or designee shall designate a hearing officer or board, the
membership of which shall not exceed three persons, to hear citations for
violations of this Part. Such hearing officer or board shall not be bound by
the rules of evidence, but may hear or receive any testimony or evidence which
is, in the discretion of such officer or board, directly relevant and material
to the issues presented. (d) At the
conclusion of the hearing, or not later than five days thereafter, such hearing
officer or board shall file a report in its official records and shall transmit
a notice of decision to the alleged violator. Such report for the official
records of the hearing officer or board shall include: (1)
the name and address of the alleged
violator; (2)
the time and place
where the parking citation was issued; (3)
the regulation(s) violated; (4)
a concise statement of the facts
established in the hearing based upon the testimony or other evidence
presented; (5)
the time and place
of the hearing; (6)
the names of
all witnesses; (7)
each
adjournment, if any, stating upon whose application and to what time and place
it was made; and
(8)
the decision
(guilty or not guilty) of the hearing officer or board. Notes
